summary_variants.short_answer: Warsaw is the capital and largest city of Poland, rebuilt after World War II into a political, cultural, and economic center.
summary_variants.kid_friendly: Warsaw is Poland's biggest city. It has colorful buildings, museums, and parks that were rebuilt after the war.
summary_variants.standard: Warsaw sits on the Vistula River in east-central Poland. It houses the national government, thriving finance and tech sectors, major universities, and a UNESCO-listed Old Town reconstructed after heavy wartime destruction.
summary_variants.expert_notes: Mention post-war socialist realist planning, modern skyline growth, and role in EU/NATO diplomacy.

notable_features: Major Central European financial and tech hub
